newsitem.title: YEMEN: Yemen Airways service employees to go on strike.
newsitem.headline: Yemen Airways service employees to go on strike.

text.p: Yemen Airways service employees said on Tuesday they would start a three-day strike at six a.m. (0300 GMT) on Wednesday at Yemen's Aden and Sanaa airports.
The strike was expected to affect other airlines flying to the country's two main airports in the absence of services, industry officials said.
An employees' union official told Reuters the strike was called after the airline failed to meet demands for salary increases.
The union is demanding several raises including a 40 percent pay increase to meet price rises and a 30 percent increase in transportation allowances.
The airline has faced a series of strikes by various employee groups including pilots and engineers.
Yemen Airways has a fleet of 13 planes and flies to 23 destinations in Asia, Africa and Europe.
